member.name: DISK_CACHE_INFORMATION
member.summary: Provides information about the disk cache.This structure is used by the IOCTL_DISK_GET_CACHE_INFORMATION and IOCTL_DISK_SET_CACHE_INFORMATION control codes.

member.name: DISK_CACHE_INFORMATION.ParametersSavable
member.summary: Indicates whether the device is capable of saving any parameters in nonvolatile storage.

member.name: DISK_CACHE_INFORMATION.ReadCacheEnabled
member.summary: Indicates whether the read cache is enabled.

member.name: DISK_CACHE_INFORMATION.WriteCacheEnabled
member.summary: Indicates whether the write cache is enabled.

summary.para: Determines the likelihood of data cached from a read operation remaining in the cache. This data might be given a different priority than data cached under other circumstances, such as from a prefetch operation.
This member can be one of the following values from the DISK_CACHE_RETENTION_PRIORITY enumeration type.

listheader.description: No data is held in the cache on a preferential basis.
A preference is to be given to prefetched data.
A preference is to be given to data cached from a read operation.

member.name: DISK_CACHE_INFORMATION.WriteRetentionPriority
member.summary: Determines the likelihood of data cached from a write operation remaining in the cache. This data might be given a different priority than data cached under other circumstances, such as from a prefetch operation.

member.name: DISK_CACHE_INFORMATION.DisablePrefetchTransferLength
member.summary: Disables prefetching. Prefetching might be disabled whenever the number of blocks requested exceeds the value in DisablePrefetchTransferLength. When zero, prefetching is disabled no matter what the size of the block request.

member.name: DISK_CACHE_INFORMATION.PrefetchScalar
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the union is a ScalarPrefetch structure. Otherwise, the union is a BlockPrefetch structure.

member.name: DISK_CACHE_INFORMATION.DUMMYUNIONNAME.ScalarPrefetch.Minimum
member.summary: The scalar multiplier of the transfer length of the request. This member is valid only when PrefetchScalar is TRUE. When PrefetchScalar is TRUE, this value is multiplied by the transfer length to obtain the minimum amount of data that can be prefetched into the cache on a disk operation.

member.name: DISK_CACHE_INFORMATION.DUMMYUNIONNAME.ScalarPrefetch.Maximum
member.summary: The scalar multiplier of the transfer length of the request. This member is valid only when PrefetchScalar is TRUE. When PrefetchScalar is TRUE, this value is multiplied by the transfer length to obtain the maximum amount of data that can be prefetched into the cache on a disk operation.

member.name: DISK_CACHE_INFORMATION.DUMMYUNIONNAME.ScalarPrefetch.MaximumBlocks
member.summary: The maximum number of blocks which can be prefetched.

member.name: DISK_CACHE_INFORMATION.DUMMYUNIONNAME.BlockPrefetch.Minimum
member.summary: The minimum amount of data that can be prefetched into the cache on a disk operation, as an absolute number of disk blocks. This member is valid only when PrefetchScalar is FALSE.

member.name: DISK_CACHE_INFORMATION.DUMMYUNIONNAME.BlockPrefetch.Maximum
member.summary: The maximum amount of data that can be prefetched into the cache on a disk operation, as an absolute number of disk blocks. This member is valid only when PrefetchScalar is FALSE.
